newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine bourse in favour of listing small firms.
newsitem.headline: Philippine bourse in favour of listing small firms.

text.p: The Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) said on Monday it supports the listing of small and medium scale enterprises.
PSE President Jose Luis Yulo told Reuters the exchange was in favour of either lowering the threshold so smaller companies could list or start a separate bourse for them.
"The reason why small and medium scale enterprises do not prosper in the Philippines is that they lack cheaper sources of funds," he said.
"By listing these firms, they will be forced to be better companies because they are under the scrutiny of the public," said Yulo.
Small and medium-scale enterprises are those with assets of 60 million pesos and below.
At present, the stock exchange only allows listing of companies that meet the 400 million pesos minimum capital requirement.
